DOC.brief_summary: PEG tubes are commonly used to provide nutritional support to patients with head and neck cancer. PEG insertions are typically carried out by gastroenterologists, but also otorhinolaryngologist - head and neck surgeons perform the procedure in some countries. Prospective studies on PEG tube placements in an ORL - HNS service are lacking. The investigators aim was to prospectively evaluate the preformance of ORL - HN surgeons in PEG tube insertions, and analyze the time gains and cost effectiveness achieved of the independency from other specialities.
DOC.brief_title: Percutaneous Endoscopic Gastrostomy in Hands of ORL-HN Surgeon
DOC.criteria: head and neck cancer as a underlying disease
